content.description: Center of face. Good edges to a moderate top out
content.location: To the right and around the corner fom Tomato's Tomato. South looking face(remember that when looking at the ocean here you're actually looking South-not West)

content.description: Sit start on good edge, one move out left, one move out right, done. All good holds, fun moves.
content.location: On the boulder behind the Smooth Patrol/Ketel One boulder. From Ketel One, turn around and you're looking at Vamp.

content.description: Start on thin holds just right of the arete with a good ledge for your feet.  Balance up and slightly left to an easier topout.
content.location: On top and towards the right side of the ridge if you're hiking in from the main (west) entrance.

content.description: Starting just right of the arete, pull up and over the small roof using a series of three sidepulls.  Tread lightly as you top out - the holds over the top are good but hollow sounding.
content.location: On top of the ridge line about 50' down from Top of the World, Ma.

content.description: Not exactly sure what the "proper" start is...I started with a left hand on the undercling under the roof and a right hand in the good pocket on the face. Starting with both hands on the undercling seems significantly harder but perhaps this is the V3 crux...I'd be interested to hear how others do it. Either way, go more or less straight up the bulging rounded arete on good holds with powerful moves.
content.location: On the southernmost boulder at the Top of the World, Ma area. This boulder is distinguished by having a cool low tunnel/cave that goes all the way through unfortunately rotten rock underneath.

content.description: Sit start on the slotted jug and move up and right through good pockets.
content.location: On the back side of the Gangster Hippie boulder, which lies down the ridge line from Tokyo Joe and pretty much straight above the Entry Way boulder.

content.description:
Start on sidepulls/edges and make one hard (i.e. fairly stout for V0+) move up to the slopey blunt arete/prow. Easy going from there.

See

this overview photo.
content.location:
Just right of and behind

The Long Goodbye.

content.description: If you're in the area and feeling reckless...sit start in the big hueco above a small boulder and head up the blunt arete.
content.location: On the boulder to the right of Top of the World, Ma.

content.description:
Start on the perfectly situated jug just below the traverse lip on the right side. Go left. Just after the little dihedral is probably the best place to top out, but obviously there are options.

Guidebook gives it V2, doesn't feel any harder than the

Mouth Traverse

though...so I compromised at V1.

Also see the

this overview photo.
content.location:
In between the

Top of the World, Ma!

cluster of problems and

Vamp

/

Ketel One.

content.description:
Start matched on a somewhat junky rail. Head up and left using a nose-shaped feature.

Awesome sloper climbing culminates in one of my favorite moves at the Mouth.

As always, if people have any info about this, please share. I'd be stoked to hear it.

My info of this problem came from here:

americanrivierabouldering.bâ€¦
content.location: Same boulder as Top of the World, Ma. Start about 5 feet to the left of that problem on a loose rail hold underneath the lip.

content.description:
I guess this route has been climbed before, but I could not find any information about it. We stumbled upon it when looking for a warm up - it wasn't a warm up.

Start on the undercling in the small roof and head straight up. Great line !

If anyone has more information about this climb, please share.
content.location: behind the top of the world boulder. Start on the undercling in the small roof and head straight up.

content.description:
Path of least resistance following the seam.

To date, I've only downclimbed this one (might be more fun as a climb).
content.location: Back side of Gangster Hippie Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on good (but scary) undercling block. Grab ear hold, then move up to top-out jugs. Good moves as long as the start hold doesn't end up in your lap!
content.location: On a small boulder in between the Entry Way Boulder and Gangster Hippie. Kiss of Death is right along a trail.

content.description:
Good (if a bit friable) edges up the steep rounded arete.

Photo coming soon...
content.location:
The Key Largo/Tokyo Joe boulder is on the hill almost directly above the Poor Slob Boulder. Key Largo is just left of

Tokyo Joe.

content.description: Start on good holds just inside the cave and under the crack (or start in the crack). Climb straight out using good locks in the left trending finger crack.
content.location: On the southernmost boulder at the Top of the World, Ma area. Ketel One is on the same boulder as Smooth Patrol but on the opposite side of the cave.

content.description:
Use the hole and/or the

Gangster Hippie

start rail to move up so you're standing in the obvious hole to the right of Gangster Hippie. Straight up on edges/slab.
content.location:
Immediately right of the obvious

Gangster Hippie.

Above the Entry Way Boulder.

content.description: Short crack that's almost silly, but worthwhile as one of the few crack problems at the Mouth.
content.location: On the back-side of the Deuce Bigelow boulder, in a small corridor located south of Top of the World, Ma.

content.description: On the back side of a smaller boulder in front of Top of the World, Ma, sit start on good holds down in a small cave and pull the roof on thinner holds.
content.location: Back side of a boulder in front of Top of the World, Ma.

content.description: Start on the right-facing jugs, and move left on some fairly bad slopers.  Set up on some sloping feet and make a big move up to a sloping rail and try to surmount the bulge.
content.location: Pretty much straight uphill from the Entry Way boulder, the starting jugs are obvious and well-chalked.

content.description: Get established on slabby ground down low and move to the obvious singular pocket high in the center of the face. Standard slabby top out.
content.location: On a south-facing boulder sort of between Top of the World, Ma and The Long Goodbye.

content.description: Sit down start on good but sandy holds. More fun than it looks.
content.location: On the smaller boulder off to the right when you're looking at Deuce Bigelow. The Black Bird starts above a well-used fire pit.
